thread.title: Mum of miracle quadruplets stunned by generosity of strangers who donate £900,000 towards her cancer battle
thread.title_full: Mum of miracle quadruplets stunned by generosity of strangers who donate £900,000 towards her cancer battle

author: Lucy Gardner
title: Mum of miracle quadruplets stunned by generosity of strangers who donate £900,000 towards her cancer battle
text:
News Mum of miracle quadruplets stunned by generosity of strangers who donate £900,000 towards her cancer battle Since launching the appeal for £4,000 five months ago the couple have received over 17,000 donations that has restored Kayla Gaytan's faith in humanity Share The couple never dreamed they would touch the lives of so many kind and generous strangers (Photo: Facebook/ gofundme) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A mum to miracle quadruplets says her "faith in humanity" has been restored after strangers donate more than £900,000 to fund her cancer battle. 
Kayla Gaytan, from Kentucky, US, was just days into her new marriage when she received the devastating news that she had Hodgkin's lymphoma . 
After five months of chemotherapy in 2016 Kayla, who was already a mum of two, was told she couldn't have any more children. 
But just one month into remission she discovered she was pregnant with not one, but four babies. 
Sadly, Kayla's cancer returned and her babies were delivered early at 30 weeks so the new mum begin treatment to fight for her life. 
Proud dad and husband, Charles Gaytan, set up their GoFundMe account in the hope of raising £4,000. 
He had no idea their plight would compel so many strangers to donate. Kayla and Charles had only just tied the knot when they received the devastating diagnoses (Photo: Facebook/ gofundme) Read More Young woman thought she had shaving rash - but it turned out to be cancer 
17,053 donations later, Kayla said: "From the bottom of our hearts our family has truly been humbled and amazed by the kindness of people. 
“It renews my faith in humanity to know that people that don’t even know us just wanted to help our family is amazing.” All four babies were born well at 30 weeks so mum could continue cancer treatment (Photo: Facebook/ gofundme) 
The brave mum's cancer treatment is expected to continue till mid 2018. 
She told People : “They say I have a 50 per cent chance of being here within the next five years, but I don’t have a choice but to fight. I have an amazing husband and family that need me.” The proud parents are eagerly awaiting for the all clear so their four miracle babies can leave hospital (Photo: Facebook/ gofundme) 
One generous donor, said: "It brings tears to our eyes to see the tally go from 18,000 to over 200,000 in ten minutes." 
Another shared their own similar experience, commenting: "In 1995 I was pregnant with my first son and diagnosed with Hodgkins and had to deliver my son early and start chemo and radiation therapy. Medicine has come so far and I know that you will get through this." The babies are now bottle feeding and expected to continue thriving (Photo: Facebook/ gofundme) Read More Dad-of-two dies from rare illness hours after marrying fiancee as his three-year-old son battles same disease 
Charles yesterday updatws the page, saying: "The babies are one month old as of yesterday. Charles and Victoria are in Cribs, Michael and Lillian are still in their incubators however should be moving to a crib shortly. 
"All the babies are eating from bottles and growing. We are hoping the are able to come home sooner than expected. Thank you so much for the prayers and support." You can donate to the family at: www.gofundme.com/2mur9fyf Like us on Facebook
